p: To assess the effect of the oil on the yeast–hyphae transition, cell suspensions of C. albicans ATCC 10231, from overnight cultures on SDA, were prepared in NYP medium [N-acetylglucosamine (10–3 mol/L), Yeast Nitrogen Base (3.35 g/L), proline (10–3 mol/L), NaCl (4.5 g/L), and pH 6.7 ± 0.1] [ 60]. The suspensions were adjusted to a density of 1.0 ± 0.2 × 10 6 CFU/mL and then distributed into glass test tubes (990 μL). Then, subinhibitory concentrations of the essential oil or fluconazole (10 µL) were added and incubated without agitation for 3 h, at 37 °C. The number of germ tubes (germinating protuberance at least as long as the diameter of the blastopore) were recorded using a light microscope (40×) and DMSO 1% ( v/ v) was used as a positive control.
